title: School combines three celebrations to highlight unity in diversity
text:
School combines three celebrations to highlight unity in diversity Teachers and students gather during the multiracial muhibbah celebration. 
JOHOR BARU: A secondary school organised three different events simultaneously to promote unity and togetherness among its multiracial students and staff. 
SMK Dato Jaafar celebrated Maulidur Rasul or Prophet Muhammad’s birthday, Chinese New Year and Ponggal on the same day to create a better understanding of the different practices observed by Malaysians from different ethnic and religious backgrounds. 
The school’s principal Mohd Hanafi Samad said he was proud to see everyone actively participating. 
“The multi-racial celebrations were also in line with the Muafakat Johor concept,” he said. 
Maulidur Rasul saw Muslim students putting up a performance depicting the life of Prophet Muhammad before listening to a religious talk. 
The Chinese New Year celebration saw a 24-festive drum performance and wushu demonstration as well as a lion dance. 
For Ponggal or the Harvest Festival, students had the chance to prepare sweet rice and create kolam designs. 
Form Six student Tan Wen Jun, 18, said the most exciting part of the festival was tossing yee sang with his classmates and teachers. 
Form Five student Harvind Singh, 17, said it was fun displaying his cooking skills while preparing sweet rice.
